p: Only two researchers have studied the effects of MD in laying hens [ 69, 70]. MD maggot meal has been reported to have been used to replace 50% of FM in a cassava-based diet without any adverse effects on FI, FCR, egg production, or shell strength. However, 100% replacement was deleterious to hen-egg production [ 69]. Finally, Dankwa et al. [ 70] showed an improvement in the clutch size, egg weight, number of eggs hatched, and chick weight of birds supplemented with 30 and 50 g of live MD.
